Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Clearly \Clear"ly\, adv. In a clear manner. [1913 Webster]

clearly adv 1: without doubt or question; "they were clearly lost"; "history has clearly shown the folly of that policy" 2: in an intelligible manner; "the foreigner spoke to us quite intelligibly" [syn: {intelligibly}, {understandably}] [ant: {unintelligibly}] 3: clear to the mind; with distinct mental discernment; "it's distinctly possible"; "I could clearly see myself in his situation" [syn: {distinctly}] 4: in an easily perceptible manner; "could be seen clearly under the microscope"; "She cried loud and clear" [syn: {clear}]
